page.secret.title: Secret Key Generator
page.secret.description: Generate strong, random cryptographic keys for your applications, APIs, and services. Perfect for JWT signing secrets, API authentication tokens, and encryption keys.
page.privacy.title: Privacy Policy
page.privacy.description: Learn how MemPhrase protects your privacy and security
page.terms.title: Terms of Service
page.terms.description: Terms and conditions for using MemPhrase
page.contact.title: Contact Us
page.contact.description: Get in touch with the MemPhrase team
page.donate.title: Support MemPhrase
page.donate.description: Help keep MemPhrase free and open source
page.security_tips.title: Security Tips
page.security_tips.description: Essential security practices for protecting your digital accounts
page.main.title: MemPhrase - Free Passphrase Generator
page.main.description: Generate strong, memorable passphrases with MemPhrase. Create secure passwords using word combinations, random characters, and customizable settings. Free, private, and runs entirely in your browser.
seo.bulk.title: Bulk Password Generator - MemPhrase
seo.bulk.description: Generate multiple secure passwords and passphrases at once. Perfect for teams and bulk account creation.
seo.guide.title: Password Guide - Understanding Security & MemPhrase - MemPhrase
seo.guide.description: Learn about password strength, entropy, how MemPhrase generates passwords, general security tips, and password managers.
seo.certificate.title: Digital Certificate Generator - MemPhrase
seo.certificate.description: Generate self-signed X.509 digital certificates for development and testing. Create SSL/TLS certificates with configurable parameters and key sizes.
seo.recovery.title: Recovery Codes Generator - MemPhrase
seo.recovery.description: Generate secure backup recovery codes for account protection. Create one-time use codes for account recovery when 2FA devices are lost or unavailable.
seo.uuid.title: UUID/GUID Generator - MemPhrase
seo.uuid.description: Generate secure UUIDs (Universally Unique Identifiers) and GUIDs. Support for UUID v4 (random), v7 (timestamp-ordered), and v1 (MAC + timestamp) formats.
seo.secret.title: Secret Key Generator - MemPhrase
seo.secret.description: Generate strong, random cryptographic keys (Base64, Base64URL, Hex) for your applications.
seo.ssh.title: SSH Key Generator - MemPhrase
seo.ssh.description: Generate secure SSH key pairs with MemPhrase. Support for Ed25519, RSA, and ECDSA key types. Free, secure, and runs entirely in your browser.
seo.templates.title: Password Templates - MemPhrase
seo.templates.description: Pre-configured password templates for common requirements and use cases.
seo.checksum.title: Checksum Generator - MemPhrase
seo.checksum.description: Generate secure checksums and hashes for text and files. Support for SHA-256, SHA-512, SHA-1, and MD5 algorithms for data integrity verification.
text.pattern_tooltip: MemPhrase uses word patterns to make passphrases more memorable while maintaining security.
text.bulk_description_full: Generate multiple secure passwords or memorable passphrases at once. Perfect for teams, bulk account creation, or when you need many unique passwords quickly.
text.guide_description_full: Learn about password security, entropy, how MemPhrase generates passwords, and best practices for protecting your digital accounts. Understand the science behind strong passwords.
text.certificate_description_full: Generate self-signed X.509 digital certificates for development, testing, and internal use. Perfect for local HTTPS development, testing SSL/TLS configurations, and internal applications.
text.recovery_description_full: Generate secure backup recovery codes for account protection. These one-time use codes help you regain access when your 2FA device is lost, stolen, or unavailable.
text.uuid_description_full: Generate cryptographically secure UUIDs (Universally Unique Identifiers) and GUIDs. Perfect for database keys, API tokens, session IDs, and unique identifiers.
text.secret_description_full: Generate strong, random cryptographic keys for your applications, APIs, and services. Perfect for JWT signing secrets, API authentication tokens, and encryption keys.
text.checksum_description_full: Generate secure checksums and hashes for data integrity verification. Support for SHA-256, SHA-512, SHA-1, and MD5 algorithms for text and files.
text.generate_instruction_words: Generate a new passphrase using the selected word categories and settings
text.generate_instruction_pronounceable: Generate a new pronounceable password with the specified complexity
text.generate_instruction_random: Generate a new random character password with the selected character types
text.tooltip_pattern: MemPhrase uses word patterns to make passphrases more memorable while maintaining security.
text.tooltip_word_count: Total number of words in your passphrase (1-7). More words significantly increase strength and memorability.
text.tooltip_word_categories: Settings for word-based part of the passphrase.
text.tooltip_capitalize: Capitalize the first letter of each word. e.g., QuickBrownFox.
text.tooltip_auto_copy: Automatically copy the generated passphrase to your clipboard.
text.tooltip_separator: Character(s) to place between words. Leave empty for no separator (words will be joined together). E.g., -, _, ., or space.
text.tooltip_numbers_symbols: Settings for including numbers and symbols in word-based passphrases.
text.tooltip_digits_count: How many digits to include (0-5). 0 means no digits.
text.tooltip_symbols_count: How many symbols to include (0-5). 0 means no symbols.
text.tooltip_customize_symbols: Customize which symbols are used for word-based passphrases.
text.tooltip_position: Where to place the numbers and/or symbols relative to the words.
text.tooltip_position_append: Add numbers/symbols at the end of the passphrase.
text.tooltip_position_prepend: Add numbers/symbols at the beginning of the passphrase.
text.tooltip_position_interspersed: Places numbers/symbols at random positions between words. If grouped separately, number block and symbol block are placed independently.
text.tooltip_grouping: How numbers and symbols are grouped if both are included.
text.tooltip_grouping_together: Numbers and symbols are combined into a single block (e.g., 123#$%)
text.tooltip_grouping_separate: If selected, number blocks and symbol blocks can be placed independently when 'Interspersed'. For 'Append'/'Prepend', they are added sequentially.
text.tooltip_syllables: Number of syllables in the pronounceable password. More syllables create longer, stronger passwords.
text.tooltip_complexity: Controls the complexity of syllable patterns. Simple uses basic consonant-vowel patterns, while complex includes digraphs and trigraphs.
text.tooltip_simple: Basic patterns with simple consonants and vowels. Easier to pronounce and type.
text.tooltip_balanced: Moderate complexity with common letter combinations. Good balance of security and usability.
text.tooltip_complex: Advanced patterns with complex consonant clusters and vowel combinations. Maximum security.
text.tooltip_formatting: General formatting options for pronounceable passwords.
text.tooltip_auto_copy: Automatically copy the generated password to your clipboard.
text.tooltip_capitalize_first: Capitalize the first letter of the password.
text.tooltip_auto_copy_password: Automatically copy the generated password to your clipboard.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_numbers: Settings for including numbers and symbols in pronounceable passwords.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_symbols: Customize which symbols are used for pronounceable passwords.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_position: Where to place the numbers and/or symbols relative to the pronounceable password.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_append: Add numbers/symbols at the end of the password.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_prepend: Add numbers/symbols at the beginning of the password.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_interspersed: Places numbers/symbols at random positions within the pronounceable password.
text.tooltip_random_symbols: Customize which symbols are used for random passwords.
text.tooltip_random_length: Length of the random character password (8-128 characters). Longer passwords are more secure.
text.tooltip_random_character_types: Configure which types of characters to include in your random password for optimal security.
text.tooltip_random_numbers_symbols: Settings for including numbers and symbols in random character passwords.
text.tooltip_random_formatting: General formatting options for random character passwords.
text.tooltip_random_position: Where to place the numbers and/or symbols in the random password.
text.tooltip_random_grouping: How numbers and symbols are grouped in the random password.
text.no_character_types_error: Please select at least one character type.
text.reset_tooltip: Reset all options to their original defaults
text.privacy_notice: All passwords are generated entirely in your browser and are never stored or transmitted.
text.footer_notice: MemPhrase is free, open-source, and privacy-focused. Your passwords never leave your device.
page.bulk.word_based_desc: Easy to remember passphrases using real words
page.bulk.random_chars_desc: Maximum security with random character combinations
page.bulk.capitalize_desc: First letter of each word uppercase
page.bulk.efficiency_desc: Generate dozens of unique passwords in seconds. Perfect for setting up multiple accounts or team onboarding scenarios.
page.bulk.consistency_desc: All passwords follow the same security configuration, ensuring consistent strength and compliance across your organization.
page.bulk.export_desc: Export in multiple formats (TXT, CSV, JSON) for easy integration with password managers or deployment scripts.
page.bulk.security_notice: All passwords are generated locally in your browser. No data is transmitted to servers.
tooltip.bulk_word_count: Number of words in each passphrase
page.certificate.warning_desc: Self-signed certificates are for development and testing only. Do not use in production environments.
page.certificate.usage_desc: This certificate can be used for:
page.certificate.security_browser: Browsers will show security warnings for self-signed certificates
page.certificate.security_production: Do not use self-signed certificates in production environments
page.certificate.security_ca: Consider using certificates from trusted Certificate Authorities for production
text.tooltip_entropy: Entropy (bits): Measures unpredictability. Higher is better. This represents the computational difficulty of guessing your password.
text.tooltip_word_count: Total number of words in your passphrase (1-7). More words significantly increase strength and memorability.
text.tooltip_word_formatting: General formatting options for the word-based passphrase.
text.tooltip_separator: Character(s) to place between words. Leave empty for no separator (words will be joined together). E.g., -, _, ., or space.
text.tooltip_numbers_symbols: Settings for including numbers and symbols in word-based passphrases.
text.tooltip_word_categories: Settings for word-based part of the passphrase.
text.tooltip_syllables: Number of syllables in the pronounceable password. More syllables create longer, stronger passwords.
text.tooltip_simple: Basic patterns with simple consonants and vowels. Easier to pronounce and type.
text.tooltip_balanced: Moderate complexity with common letter combinations. Good balance of security and usability.
text.tooltip_complex: Advanced patterns with complex consonant clusters and vowel combinations. Maximum security.
text.tooltip_password_length: Length of the random character password (8-128 characters). Longer passwords are more secure.
text.tooltip_include_lowercase: Include lowercase letters (a-z) in the password
text.tooltip_include_uppercase: Include uppercase letters (A-Z) in the password
text.tooltip_include_symbols: Include special symbols (!@#$ etc.) in the password
text.tooltip_digits_count: How many digits to include (0-5). 0 means no digits.
text.tooltip_symbols_count: How many symbols to include (0-5). 0 means no symbols.
text.tooltip_position: Where to place the numbers and/or symbols relative to the words.
text.tooltip_position_append: Add numbers/symbols at the end of the passphrase.
text.tooltip_position_prepend: Add numbers/symbols at the beginning of the passphrase.
text.tooltip_position_interspersed: Places numbers/symbols at random positions between words. If grouped separately, number block and symbol block are placed independently.
text.tooltip_grouping: How numbers and symbols are grouped if both are included.
text.tooltip_grouping_together: Numbers and symbols are combined into a single block (e.g., 123#$%)
text.tooltip_grouping_separate: If selected, number blocks and symbol blocks can be placed independently when 'Interspersed'. For 'Append'/'Prepend', they are added sequentially.
text.tooltip_pattern: MemPhrase uses word patterns to make passphrases more memorable while maintaining security.
